title: Introduction to Herbal Medicine - Module 1 Quiz

questions.question: What is herbal medicine?
choices: The use of plants and plant extracts for therapeutic purposes
The use of synthetic drugs to treat illnesses
The study of animal behavior in natural habitats
The practice of diagnosing diseases using medical imaging
questions.answer: The use of plants and plant extracts for therapeutic purposes

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key principle of herbal medicine?
choices: Supporting the body's innate healing abilities

questions.question: Herbal medicine has its origins in:
choices: Traditional medicine systems and indigenous healing practices
questions.answer: Traditional medicine systems and indigenous healing practices

questions.question: How does herbal medicine differ from conventional medicine in its approach to treatment?
choices: Herbal medicine takes a holistic approach, while conventional medicine focuses on symptomatic treatment
Herbal medicine relies on synthetic drugs, while conventional medicine uses natural remedies
Herbal medicine is based on scientific research, while conventional medicine is based on traditional knowledge
Herbal medicine focuses on treating a single organ system, while conventional medicine takes a whole-body approach
questions.answer: Herbal medicine takes a holistic approach, while conventional medicine focuses on symptomatic treatment

questions.question: The holistic approach in herbal medicine considers which of the following aspects of health?
Why is accurate plant identification important in herbal medicine?
choices: To ensure safety and efficacy of treatments
To make the medicine taste better
To increase the cost of herbal remedies
To make the packaging more attractive
questions.answer: To ensure safety and efficacy of treatments

questions.question: What is the hierarchical classification system used in plant taxonomy?
choices: Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species
Domain, Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species
Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species, Subspecies
Kingdom, Phylum, Order, Class, Family, Genus, Species
questions.answer: Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species
